newsitem.title: ITALY: BankItaly's Fazio urges banks to cut deposit rates.
newsitem.headline: BankItaly's Fazio urges banks to cut deposit rates.

text.p: Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio urged banks to lower deposit rates, cut costs and review commercial policy and organisation.
Fazio, speaking at the Interbank Guarantee Fund, said: "The fall in yields on state debt opens up the possibility of a reduction in deposit rates which till now the banks have not seized completely."
Earlier this month, Fazio and Italian bankers agreed there was room for a reduction in the range of bank lending rates which would bring down the average cost for clients wanting to borrow money.
Fazio said the situation in the Italian banking sector remained difficult, with only "modest growth" in loans and "sustained" growth in bad loans.

But he said "unbearable pressures on banks' profitability" came from costs, in which management costs now absorbed "more than two thirds of earnings margins," which he said was an unprecedented level.
